page.title: 02WELCOME (continued)
page.content: The town actually got its name from river Eden which runs through the town centre. Nearby villages are Marlpit Hill, Marsh Green, Lingfield, Four Elms, Hever, Chiddingstone, Cowden and Bough Beech. Education in the town is organised on a three_tier basis. There are six First Schools in Edenbridge and the outlying villages. At nine years old the children transfer to the Middle School in the town and at thirteen move to the Upper School, Eden Valley. It is still possible to sit the 11+ examination and if successful, one can transfer to the Grammar Schools in Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells. There are also private fee_paying schools in the area....by Ilsa Reynolds.
